pages.text: Isotelus was a common asaphid trilobite and the rex species is currently the world's largest trilobite found as a complete fossil. Isotelus was a bottom feeder who probably used its limbs to sift through the sand for potential prey.
$(l)Eats:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Drops Egg$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Bucket
